info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 11 at 3:08AM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Spread of Wildfire Is Possible Friday... .A strong cold front Friday morning will likely bring a surge of very dry air and strong northwesterly winds Friday. Winds will likely diminish Friday evening. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE COMBINATION OF LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS, AND DRYING FUELS, FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS EXCEPT THE BARRIER ISLAND... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Fire Weather Watch for the combination of very low humidity, strong northwest winds, and drying fuels, which is in effect from Friday morning through Friday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...All of the Rio Grande Valley and Deep South Texas Except the Barrier Island. * TIMING...6 AM Friday through 6 PM Friday. * WINDS...North 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 69. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Rapid spread of wildfire on drying grasses and brush is possible Friday.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
